children.Description:
Eclipse Common Lisp Editor
a Common Lisp plugin for the Eclipse IDE.
children.Name: dandelion

children.Description:
Common Lisp Erlang Interface
a Common Lisp Erlang Interface. An implementation of the Erlang distribution protocol, comparable with erl_interface and jinterface. [MIT][200].
children.Name: CLERIC

children.Description:
Yet another routes handling utility on top of Hunchentoot
a routes handling system on top of Hunchentoot. It supports dispatch based on HTTP method, arguments extraction from the url path, decorators, url generation from route name, etc. [MIT][200].
children.Name: easy-routes

children.Description:
Run CGI scripts from the hunchentoot web server
a library for executing CGI scripts from the hunchentoot webserver. [BSD][207].
children.Name: hunchentoot-cgi

children.Description: Route multiple domains (virtual hosts) on a single hunchentoot acceptor using a single port
children.Name: hunchentoot-multi-acceptor

children.Description:
A lightweight, async HTTP client
A lightweight, async HTTP client built on top of cl-async and fast-http. [MIT][200].
children.Name: carrier

children.Description: A fast HTTP request/response parser for Common Lisp.
children.Name: fast-http

children.Description:
Brew formula generator for common lisp projects
Homebrew formula builder for (command line) common lisp applications. Public domain.
children.Name: cl-brewer

children.Description: Update cl-* debian packages from Quicklisp releases.
children.Name: ql-to-deb

children.Description:
Common Lisp Machine Learning Library
originally developped by Mathematicl Systems Inc., a Japanese company. With a [tutorial](https://mmaul.github.io/clml.tutorials//2015/08/08/CLML-Time-Series-Part-1.html). [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: clml

children.Description:
Quicklisp systems to debian packages
Quicklisp systems to debian packages, along with [deb-packager](https://github.com/ralt/deb-packager) (simply create a debian package by defining an s-expression) and an introductory [blog post](http://margaine.com/2015/12/22/quicklisp-packagecloud-debian-packages.html). Both [MIT][200].
children.Name: qldeb

children.Description:
AllegroServe, a web server written in Common Lisp
A portable fork of AllegroServe, by Franz Inc.  [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: aserve

children.Description:
Common Lisp NLP toolset
Natural language processing toolset. [Apache2.0][89].
children.Name: cl-nlp

children.Description:
HTTP/2 interop library in Common Lisp
a pure Common Lisp transport agnostic implementation of the HTTP/2 protocol at draft-14. [MIT][200].
children.Name: cl-http2-protocol

children.Description: A fast non-blocking HTTP server on top of libev
children.Name: woo

children.Description:
The public release of the Babel2 framework, a framework for Fluid Construction Grammar, multi-agent experiments and Incremental Recruitment Language.
A Fluid Construction Grammar implementation, computational framework, and unification-based grammar formalism [Apache2.0][89].
children.Name: Babel2

children.Description:
Asynchronous HTTP server in common lisp
Asynchronous HTTP server. [Expat][14].
children.Name: wookie

children.Description:
dh for quicklisp-based applications generating binaries
debhelper utility to let you compile your quicklisp-based Common Lisp code into a buildapp binary in a .deb with almost no effort. [MIT][200].
children.Name: dh-quicklisp-buildapp

children.Description:
A natural language understanding system for English
A natural
children.Name: sparser

children.Description:
Common Lisp editor/IDE with high expansibility
a ready to use, Emacs-like, Slime-based
children.Name: lem

children.Description:
Common Lisp 3D/2D Graphics Engine for OpenGL
Common Lisp 2D/3D graphics engine for OpenGL. [FreeBSD][39].
children.Name: clinch

children.Description:
An image processing library for Common Lisp
a library for representing and processing images. [BSD_2Clause][17].
children.Name: opticl

children.Description: Cocoa interface code written in Lisp for use with Clozure Common Lisp (CCL)
children.Name: CocoaInterface

children.Description:
Common Lisp CFFI bindings to the Horde3D graphics library.
FFI bindings to the Horde3D graphics library. Not available on Quicklisp. [EPL 1.0][59]
children.Name: cl-horde3d

children.Description:
Color library for Common Lisp
exact color manipulation and conversion in various color models. [MIT][200].
children.Name: dufy

children.Description:
Lispbuilder provides a range of libraries for developing useful portable Common Lisp applications
A set of bindings for SDL. [Expat][14].
children.Name: lispbuilder

children.Description:
Graph Drawing DSL (or Graphviz Interface) for Common Lisp.
Graph drawing DSL for Common Lisp. [Expat][14].
children.Name: donuts

children.Description:
Produce Scalable Vector Graphics files with Common Lisp
A basic library for producing SVG files. [Expat][14].
children.Name: cl-svg

children.Description:
The OpenCV binding library for CommonLisp
the OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) binding library for CommonLisp. No license specified.
children.Name: common-cv

children.Description:
Common Lisp binding for Gtk+
A binding for GTK+2. [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: cl-gtk2

children.Description:
Common Lisp bindings for SDL2 using C2FFI.
Bindings for SDL2 using C2FFI. [Expat][14].
children.Name: cl-sdl2

children.Description:
Lisp to GLSL Language Translator
Lisp to GLSL translator. [BSD_2Clause][17].
children.Name: varjo

children.Description:
Yet another Common Lisp game engine
Trial is an OpenGL
children.Name: trial

children.Description:
ImageMagick bindings (fork)
ImageMagick bindings. [BSD][15]. Not in Quicklisp.
children.Name: lisp-magick-wand

children.Description: A PNG (Portable Network Graphics) image format decoder in portable Common Lisp with an emphasis on speed.
children.Name: pngload-fast

children.Description:
Common Lisp CFFI bindings to the IUP Portable User Interface library (pre-ALPHA)
CFFI bindings to the [IUP](https://www.tecgraf.puc-rio.br/iup/) Portable User Interface library (pre-ALPHA). IUP is cross-platform (Windows, macOS, GNU/Linux, with new Android, iOs, Cocoa and Web Assembly drivers), has many widgets, has a small api and is actively developed.
children.Name: iup

children.Description:
A Common Lisp library for reading and writing JPEG image files
Baseline JPEG encoder and decoder library. [3-clause BSD][15].
children.Name: cl-jpeg

children.Description:
Cairo bindings for Common Lisp
Cairo bindings. [Boost 1.0][54]
children.Name: cl-cairo2

children.Description:
cl-opengl is a set of CFFI bindings to the OpenGL, GLU and GLUT APIs.
CFFI bindings to OpenGL, GLU and GLUT APIs. [3-clause BSD][15].
children.Name: cl-opengl

children.Description:
#cl-cffi-gtk on Freenode. A Lisp binding to GTK+3. SBCL/CCL/ABCL (ECL/CLISP unstable)
Binding for GTK+3. [GNU LGPL2.1][11].
children.Name: cl-cffi-gtk

children.Description:
General definitions reflection library
a general definitions introspection library. It gives you the ability to retrieve definitions or bindings associated with designators such as symbols, packages, and names in general. [Artistic License 2.0][51].
children.Name: definitions

children.Description:
A couple of lambda shorthand macros
a couple of lambda shorthand macros. `(fn* (+ _ _))  -->  (lambda (_) (+ _ _))`. Public domain.
children.Name: fn

children.Description:
Algebraic data types in Common Lisp
A library for defining algebraic data types in a similar spirit to Haskell or ML. [3-clause BSD][15].
children.Name: cl-algebraic-data-type

children.Description:
JSON encoder and decoder.
A JSON encoder and decoder. [MIT][200].
children.Name: jonathan

children.Description: Bringing the speed of Static Dispatch to CLOS. Succeeded by https://github.com/marcoheisig/fast-generic-functions
children.Name: inlined-generic-function

children.Description:
reader/writer for the JSON format in common lisp
A reader and writer for the JSON format. [Expat][14].
children.Name: jsown

children.Description:
Generic function interface to standard Common Lisp functions
Generic function interface to standard Common Lisp functions (equality, comparison, arithmetic, objects, iterator, sequences,…). [MIT][200]. See also the more lightweight [generic-comparability](https://github.com/pnathan/generic-comparability). [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: generic-cl

children.Description:
Common Lisp with Arc Macros and Procedures
Arc language's brevity and conciseness to Common Lisp. [Artistic License 2.0][51].
children.Name: Clamp

children.Description:
Common Lisp in the 21st Century.
An experimental project to move Common Lisp into the 21st century. [Expat][14].
children.Name: cl21

children.Description:
Reader Syntax Coventions for Common Lisp and SLIME
Reader syntax conventions. [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: cl-syntax

children.Description:
A different type of generic function for common lisp.
generic functions based on types. Simplified BSD License variant.
children.Name: specialization-store

children.Description:
Static generic function dispatch for Common Lisp
allows standard generic function dispatch to be performed statically (at compile time) rather than dynamically (runtime). This is similar to what is known as "overloading" in languages such as C++ and Java. [MIT][200].
children.Name: static-dispatch

children.Description: Hooks extension point mechanism (as known, e.g., from GNU Emacs)
children.Name: architecture.hooks

children.Description:
Yet Another Common Lisp YaML processor
a pure lisp YAML processor (loader, but not yet dumper). [GPL3][2].
children.Name: cl-yaclyaml

children.Description: A shortcut macro to write DEFCLASS forms quickly
children.Name: defclass-std

children.Description:
A Common Lisp implementation of the dataflow programming paradigm
an implementation of the dataflow programming paradigm, reactive spreadsheet-like expressiveness for CLOS. Used to build an [algebra learning system](http://tiltontec.com/). With [documentation](https://github.com/stefano/cells-doc/). Lisp LGPL.
children.Name: cells

children.Description:
Utilities beyond Alexandria
Another general-purpose utility library. [Expat][14].
children.Name: serapeum

children.Description:
Some utilities that are used by FSet and also are useful in conjunction with FSet.
A concise and extensible iteration facility that has the advantage of integrating well with FSet (see the Data Structures section), as it was written by the same author. In Quicklisp as part of `misc-extensions`. Public domain.
children.Name: misc-extensions

children.Description:
Mozilla XUL bindings for Common Lisp
Mozilla XUL bindings. [Expat][14].
children.Name: cl-xul

children.Description:
A binding to WebKitGTK+ for Common Lisp
A binding to WebKitGTK+. Also adds web browsing capabilities to an application, leveraging the full power of the WebKit browsing engine. [MIT][200].
children.Name: cl-webkit

children.Description:
Anonymous lambda literal in Common Lisp, respecting Scala
Scala-like anonymous lambda literals. `(mapcar ^(* 2 _) '(1 2 3 4 5))`. [MIT][200].
children.Name: cl-punch

children.Description:
unofficial mirror of git://git.code.sf.net/p/series/series (Richard C. Waters' SERIES package for Common Lisp)
Functional style without any runtime penalty at all. [MIT][200].
children.Name: series

children.Description:
Radical Utilities for Common Lisp
radical yet reasonable syntactic utilities for Common Lisp. [MIT][200].
children.Name: rutils

children.Description: A simple and unintrusive read table modification inspired by Python's three quote strings.
children.Name: pythonic-string-reader

children.Description:
Corman Lisp
a Common Lisp development environment for Microsoft Windows running on Intel platforms. [MIT][200].
children.Name: cormanlisp

children.Description:
A utility library intended at providing reader macros for lambdas, arrays, accessors, hash-tables and hash-sets.
A utility library
children.Name: reader

children.Description:
Screamer is an extension of Common Lisp that adds support for nondeterministic programming.
augment Common
children.Name: screamer

children.Description: increasing the expressiveness of SCREAMER. [MIT][200].
children.Name: screamer-plus

children.Description:
Common Lisp Win32 GUI library 
A Win32 GUI library. [MIT][200].
children.Name: ftw

children.Description: A metaclass for bridging CLOS and JSON objects
children.Name: json-mop

children.Description:
Thin wrapper over Nuklear for Common Lisp
Wrapper over the [Nuklear](https://github.com/vurtun/nuklear) immediate mode GUI library. [MIT][200].
children.Name: bodge-nuklear

children.Description:
clasp Common Lisp environment
a new Common Lisp implementation that seamlessly interoperates with C++ libraries and programs using LLVM for compilation to native code. This allows Clasp to take advantage of a vast array of preexisting libraries and programs, such as out of the scientific computing ecosystem. [LGPL2.1][11] (and others).
children.Name: clasp

children.Description:
Json encoder and decoder for Common-Lisp
A highly customizable JSON encoder and decoder. [Expat][14].
children.Name: cl-json

children.Description: Common Interface to ISO Prolog implementations from Common Lisp
children.Name: cl-prolog2

children.Description:
A contract programming library for Common Lisp in the style of Eiffel’s Design by Contract ™.
a contract
children.Name: quid-pro-quo

children.Description:
Arrow-macros provides Clojure-like arrow macros in Common Lisp
Clojure-like threading macros. [MIT][200].
children.Name: arrow-macros

children.Description:
Filtered functions provide an extension of CLOS generic function invocation that add a simple preprocessing step before the actual method dispatch is performed and thus enable the use of arbitrary predicates for selecting and applying methods.
enable the use of arbitrary predicates for selecting and applying methods. [MIT][200].
children.Name: filtered-functions

children.Description: Tiny CL library to retrieve the arguments list of a function.
children.Name: trivial-arguments

children.Description:
Python-like Annotation Syntax for Common Lisp
Python-like annotations for Common Lisp. [LLGPL][8].
children.Name: cl-annot

children.Description:
A Common Lisp kernel for Jupyter along with a library for building Jupyter kernels.
A Common Lisp kernel for Jupyter along with a library for building Jupyter kernels, based on Maxima-Jupyter by Robert Dodier which was based on cl-jupyter by Frederic Peschanski. [MIT][200].
children.Name: common-lisp-jupyter

children.Description:
An enhanced interactive Shell for Common Lisp (based on the Jupyter protocol)
A Common Lisp kernel for Jupyter notebooks [custom licence](https://github.com/fredokun/cl-jupyter/blob/master/LICENSE).
children.Name: cl-jupyter

children.Description:
The notebook-style Common Lisp environment
A
children.Name: darkmatter

children.Description: A portable reader and bridge for interacting with Objective-C and Cocoa
children.Name: objc-lisp-bridge

children.Description:
A project-local library installer for Common Lisp
A project-local library installer, similar to Bundler or Carton. [Expat][14].
children.Name: qlot

children.Description:
Qi - A Package Manager for Common Lisp
A package manager with a traditional approach. [BSD][15].
children.Name: qi

children.Description:
Print licenses used by the given project and its dependencies.
print licenses used by a project and its dependencies. [MIT][200].
children.Name: print-licenses

children.Description:
Add syntax highlighting and other goodies to Practical Common Lisp by Peter Seibel.
.
children.Name: practical-cl-beautified

children.Description: An implementation of Python in Common Lisp
children.Name: cl-python

children.Description:
Common Lisp for Python
The library cl4py (pronounce as clappy) allows Python programs to call Common Lisp libraries. [MIT][200].
children.Name: cl4py

children.Description:
A bridge between Python and Lisp (FFI bindings, etc.)
A bridge between Python and Common Lisp. The goal is that Lisp programs can use Python libraries. Not available on Quicklisp. No license specified.
children.Name: burgled-batteries

children.Description:
Call python from Common Lisp
A library that allows Common Lisp code to access Python libraries. It is basically the inverse of cl4py. [MIT][200].
children.Name: py4cl

children.Description:
A full-featured repl implementation designed to work with Roswell
an ipython-like REPL. With completion, shell commands, magic commands, debugger, etc. [MIT][200]. With [colorthemes](https://github.com/koji-kojiro/lem-pygments-colorthemes).
children.Name: cl-repl

children.Description:
Editing facility for Common Lisp REPL
a tiny editing facility, where you can directly load, edit, manipulate and evaluate file or file content from the REPL, when going to a full IDE is too much. [MIT][200].
children.Name: magic-ed

children.Description:
A Common Lisp dev environment for Vim (and Neovim)
VLIME: Vim plus Lisp Is Mostly Evil. A Common Lisp dev environment for Vim (and Neovim). [MIT][200].
children.Name: vlime

children.Description: slimv in a container
children.Name: slimv_box

children.Description:
Official mirror of Slimv versions released on vim.org
Superior Lisp Interaction Mode for Vim; a full-blown environment for Common Lisp inside of Vim. No license specified.
children.Name: slimv
